model.chip_description: Access line, 16 MHz STM8S 8-bit MCU, up to 32 Kbyte Flash, integrated EEPROM, 10-bit ADC, timers, UART, SPI, I2C Core - 16 MHz advanced STM8 core with Harvard architecture and 3-stage pipeline - Extended instruction set Memories - Program memory: 32 Kbyte Flash; data retention 20 years at 55 °C after 10 kcycle - Data memory: 1 Kbyte true data EEPROM; endurance 300 kcycle - RAM: 2 Kbyte Clock, reset and supply management - 2.95 to 5.5 V operating voltage - Flexible clock control, 4 master clock sources - Low power crystal resonator oscillator - External clock input - Internal, user-trimmable 16 MHz RC - Internal low-power 128 kHz RC - Clock security system with clock monitor - Power management: - Low-power modes (wait, active-halt, halt) - Switch-off peripheral clocks individually - Permanently active, low-consumption power-on and power-down reset - Interrupt management - Nested interrupt controller with 32 interrupts - Up to 37 external interrupts on 6 vectors Timers - Advanced control timer: 16-bit, 4 CAPCOM channels, 3 complementary outputs, dead-time insertion and flexible synchronization - 2x16-bit general purpose timer, with 2+3 CAPCOM channels (IC, OC or PWM) - 8-bit basic timer with 8-bit prescaler - Auto wake-up timer - Window watchdog and independent watchdog timers Communication interfaces - UART with clock output for synchronous operation, SmartCard, IrDA, LIN master mode - SPI interface up to 8 Mbit/s - I2C interface up to 400 kbit/s Analog to digital converter (ADC) - 10-bit, ±1 LSB ADC with up to 10 multiplexed channels, scan mode and analog watchdog I/Os - Up to 38 I/Os on a 48-pin package including 16 high sink outputs - Highly robust I/O design, immune against current injection Unique ID - 96-bit unique key for each device Debug mode: - SWIM)

register.name: PA_ODR
register.note: Writing to the ODR register when in output mode applies a digital value to the I/O through the latch. Reading the ODR returns the previously latched value in the register. In Input mode, writing in the ODR register, latches the value in the register but does not change the pin state. The ODR register is always cleared after reset. Bit read-modify-write instructions (BSET, BRST) can be used on the DR register to drive an individual pin without affecting the others.

field.name: PA_ODR0
field.description: Logic output state for PA0 pin

field.name: PA_ODR1
field.description: Logic output state for PA1 pin

field.description: Logic output state for PA2 pin

field.name: PA_ODR6
field.description: Logic output state for PA6 pin

field.name: PA_ODR7
field.description: Logic output state for PA7 pin

register.name: PA_IDR
register.note: The pin register can be used to read the pin value irrespective of whether port is in input or output mode. This register is read-only.

field.name: PA_IDR0
field.description: Logic input level of PA0 pin

field.description: Logic input level of PA1 pin

register.name: PA_DDR
register.note: These bits are set and cleared by software to select input or output mode for a particular pin of a port.

register.name: PA_CR1
register.note: These bits are set and cleared by software. They select different functions in input mode and output mode.

interpretation.text: Input mode (DDR = 0): Floating input Output mode (DDR = 1): Pseudo open drain
Input mode (DDR = 0): Input with pull-up Output mode (DDR = 1): Push-pull, speed depends CR2 bit
Input mode (DDR = 0): Floating input Output mode (DDR = 1): Pseudo open drain
Input mode (DDR = 0): Input with pull-up Output mode (DDR = 1): Push-pull, speed depends CR2 bit

register.name: PA_CR2
register.note: These bits are set and cleared by software. They select different functions in input mode and output mode. In input mode, the CR2 bit enables the interrupt capability if available. If the I/O does not have interrupt capability, setting the CR2 bit has no effect. In output mode, setting the bit increases the speed of the I/O.

interpretation.text: Input mode (DDR = 0): External interrupt disabled Output mode (DDR = 1): Output speed up to 2 MHz
Input mode (DDR = 0): External interrupt enabled Output mode (DDR = 1): Output speed up to 10 MHz

register.name: PF_ODR
register.note: Writing to the ODR register when in output mode applies a digital value to the I/O through the latch. Reading the ODR returns the previously latched value in the register. In Input mode, writing in the ODR register, latches the value in the register but does not change the pin state. The ODR register is always cleared after reset. Bit read-modify-write instructions (BSET, BRST) can be used on the DR register to drive an individual pin without affecting the others.

field.description: Logic output state for PF0 pin

register.name: PF_IDR
register.note: The pin register can be used to read the pin value irrespective of whether port is in input or output mode. This register is read-only.

register.name: PF_DDR
register.note: These bits are set and cleared by software to select input or output mode for a particular pin of a port.

register.name: PF_CR1
register.note: These bits are set and cleared by software. They select different functions in input mode and output mode.

register.name: PF_CR2
register.note: These bits are set and cleared by software. They select different functions in input mode and output mode. In input mode, the CR2 bit enables the interrupt capability if available. If the I/O does not have interrupt capability, setting the CR2 bit has no effect. In output mode, setting the bit increases the speed of the I/O.
